name: 1-ethylpiperazine-2,3-dione
Reason: 1-ethylpiperazine-2,3-dione has a melting point of 106°C due to the presence of two carbonyl groups, which can form strong hydrogen bonds and rigidify the structure, contributing around +20 to +40°C for each carbonyl. The ethyl group may decrease the melting point by around -10°C due to the increased molecular weight and reduced symmetry. The piperazine base contributes around +106°C.
